page.title: 14Nature.
page.content: Close to the village a kingfisher is nesting in the canal bank.Near the canal bridge there are a pair of moorhens;further on there are lapwings.Housemartins swoop low to scoop water. Three ponds and the canal are good places to fish.The most common fish are gudgeon and roach.Other catches are bream,tench,perch,eel,chub and stickleback. Pigeon fancying is a popular hobby.Some people keep pigeons in gardens,others keep lofts on allotments.The club meets on Friday nights where races and shows are organised by Stainforth Pigeon Club.
